txt.en: 'Valiantly done, [placeholder]! You have done us all a great service and are deserving of the highest praise for your role in holding the line!\n\n'I'd like to see those brigands try this again; they thought that the ability to wield a blade would be enough to challenge a line of Wardens? Are they mad? They must be!'
'Let us return to Bree, [placeholder], and we will discuss some of the finer points of your performance during the attack.'
Instance: A Spear at the Southern March

'You are to be my ally in the defence, [placeholder]? I am glad to hear it!\n\n'I will show you the bounds of our position. You must not stray beyond these bounds during the attack, my friend! The line must not be compromised!'
'Blah!'
Toby Thorndyke has fallen and the line has been breached
'Fly! They are too well-trained!'
The attack has been repelled
'A pox on these Wardens!'
You strayed from your position, and the defence suffered for it
Andrew Oakhurst is behind the line of Wardens south of Bree-town.\n\nWarden Oakhurst is waiting to speak with you.
'Run away! We cannot beat them!'
Toby Thorndyke is at your place in the line of Wardens defending Bree-town from attack from the south.
Andrew Oakhurst is behind the line of Wardens south of Bree-town.\n\nThe attack has been successfully repelled, and you should speak now to Warden Oakhurst.
'Hold the line, [placeholder]!'
'Do not leave your position, [placeholder]!'
'Hold, [placeholder]! Do not let the line falter!'
'Do not leave your place in the line, [placeholder]!'
Talk to Toby Thorndyke
'Take up your position next to Toby Thorndyke, [placeholder].'
Maintain your position in the line and defend Toby Thorndyke
'Prepare for battle!'
Do not abandon your place in the line
Talk to Andrew Oakhurst
'We must hold our position in the line, [placeholder].'
'Our section of the line is from this tree...'
'...to this stone.'
'A good Warden does not stray from his position in the line!'
You have agreed to join the line of Wardens defending the approach to Bree-town from a band of brigands approaching from the south.
'Reform the line!'
'Maintain the line, Wardens!'
'Steady! Do not abandon your places!'
'Keep the line, [placeholder]!'
'We must keep our position, [placeholder]!'

'I am glad you agreed to aid us, [placeholder], for there is a gap in our line, and I would have it filled.

'Speak with Toby Thorndyke, just ahead, and he will show you to your spot in line.

'It is very important that you not abandon your place in the line once the attack begins! An organized defence is our best weapon against bands of brigands such as the one that approaches.'
